metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14771 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: Server: Security: LDAP Auth). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.31 and prior and 8.0.21 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a partial denial of service (partial DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 2.2 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-14771` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.10.2
mysql-client - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.10.2
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.10.2
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.10.2
mysql-router - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.10.2
mysql-server - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.10.2
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.10.2
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.10.2
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.10.2
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.10.2
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.10.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored.

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.10.2').
